triples.name: Mobile robot
triples.relevance: The survey focuses on multiple mobile robots and their task planning capabilities, making mobile robotics the central subject.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Motion planning is a fundamental technique discussed throughout the survey for coordinating robot movement and path computation.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: The survey integrates task-level planning with motion constraints, which is core to automated planning and scheduling.

triples.name: Autonomous robot
triples.relevance: The paper addresses autonomous systems and independent robot decision-making in multi-robot environments.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Swarm robotics represents a key approach to multi-robot coordination and cooperative task execution.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: The survey explicitly mentions advances in AI as enabling complex problem-solving in multi-robot systems.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent systems provide the theoretical foundation for understanding multiple robots working cooperatively.
